title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviews took place over Zoom meetings. The interviewer was well-mannered and organized the interview with generic questions that are seen throughout different nursing application opportunities. Make sure you know how to describe yourself and highlight the key points that were mentioned in your Resume such as your skills and strengths.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: One interview over the phone (took place in 2020). Supposed to be a panel of 3, only 1 was able to attend. Received a call less than an hour later with an offer.
Interview Questions: How do I incorporate their core values into my own practice?

title: Or Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed. I enjoyed the staff and I felt very comfortable. The questions were pretty standard. Just be yourself and ask any questions that you have regarding the position because it may take awhile before you hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself? What is your weakness? What can you bring to the team?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at ECU Health in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: 20 minutes long. Questions were of average difficulty, the interviewer was conversational. The questions were easy to answer. The first question was tell me about yourself. I enjoyed the interview.
Interview Questions: If you could be an animal, which one would you choose?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at ECU Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Nice over all, very simple. Scheduled easily! I was prepared for a long time and then it just came up that the next time we had a problem we would be in a hurry and I
Interview Questions: What is your name today

title: Supervisor of Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively smooth in my opinion. I do believe had they not had a job fair many of the people wouldn't have had an opportunity to interview for any role.
Interview Questions: How do I think my former work experience will help me in the role?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: The role provides strategic leadership in the development and execution of value-based care and related population health principles. Works closely with executive leadership. Oversight of comprehensive clinical care management programs including inpatient and ambulatory programs and utilization review services
Interview Questions: 2.	How would you define health equity

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick process - zoom call , in office interview with quick comprehension test pertaining background knowledge for the role. Recruiter  , hiring manager, and staff were great ! They made the interview process fun and easy.
Interview Questions: Most questions were about basic billing codes and as you as a worker.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward  ask questions and let you be yourself  then said I should hear something either way very soon so I am patiently wait I did phone interview as well
Interview Questions: Tell me why we should hire you

title: Covid Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual and took about 20 minutes. First she gave the description of the job along with what a typical day is like. Then she asked about 10 scenario style questions.
Interview Questions: If someone did not want to speak to you because of your skin color how would you handle the situation?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at ECU Health (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Overall great experience. Was straight to the point and really needed nurses. They also allowed time to ask questions and gave options in terms of department that I may prefer to work
Interview Questions: Just basically told me about the job

title: ETL Data Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by recruiterof this company through email, and there was no phone call with the recruiter. SHe directly scheduled an interview with the manager. The manager asked very basic questions like the tools i use and my current role and he said that I have skills that they were looking for. He also told me that I was the first person they interviewed for this role and told me to wait for a month regarding the next round. After that, there was no response from the Manager or the recruiter. Emailed them multiple times and still no response. We can't even look at the status of our application in their job portal and finally, they posted Not selected in there. I didn't even get an email that I was not selected until I looked up in their job portal.
Interview Questions:
What ETL tools you use right now?
WHat kind of data you deal with?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, asked behavioral questions.  Applied, got a call back in a week. Scheduled interview for two weeks later. Recruiter was very nice and willing to work with you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with manager went very well , basic questions asked, supppsed to be soon but didn’t end up doing that just telephone call, asked what were weakness and strength, described position and discussed training, encouraged going to school for nursing
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The clinical nutrition manager was very professional. She was quick in reaching out to schedule the interview. She followed up personally when they made their decision.  She gave great feedback on the interview.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself.

title: Line Service Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point.  Had an interview with the manager, then the Chief of the department.  Same questions both time.  Got the job, but it was nothing similar to what I was interviewed for
Interview Questions: What experience do you have

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fair and easy the onboarding process is horrible it’s taking an extreme amount of time and back and forth all for a job. I want to work and help people it what I love to do but I don’t need a job. I don’t need this type of stress to assist a company
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in this position?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview online 3 step process telephone interview then a Skype interview and finally interview the with clinics director. It was very informative and the questions were well thought out and easy to respond to.
Interview Questions: They asked what cognitive behavior approaches I use in my practice

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very brief and to the point, it was was standard considering the position and was given helpful information on the position. Overall a comfortable experience that was brief and to the point
Interview Questions: My experience in customer service

title: Flight Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: There was a meeting with human resources to start with that discussed benefits and the amenities of the town. The actual interview was brief and informal. The interview seemed mostly personality based with very little focus on the job description.
Interview Questions: Recent experience

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Overall good experience. I did an in-person interview at the PT clinic. The interviewed was with the PT manager and the PT/PTA team. I was asked typical question and was given the opportunity to questions. I also toured the hospital and area.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is really relaxed. The HR and department manager make you feel at home and thoroughly walk you through what will be expected of you on a day to day basis. I was made well aware of all of the benefits and perks offered here and was offered a job on the spot.
Interview Questions: What positive qualities can you bring to our team?

title: Transport Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at ECU Health (Roanoke Rapids, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was informative and the questions they ask help one figure out whether the job you are applying is what you really want to do. It was an easy going interview.
Interview Questions: Do you enjoy working as a service to others?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly quick. Interview lasted approximately 30 minutes...a lot lesser than I thought it would. The  questions asked were as I expected... straight forward and to the point.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: End User Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: My process was quickly handled. I met with the manager of my department, and after about 2 weeks I heard back about the position. Then I waited for HR to contact me to officially offer me the job and negotiate salary
Interview Questions: Experience, What was I looking to get out of the position.

title: RN Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Recruiting was lengthy, Interview was not representative of job nor had anything to do with position.  Time was spent discussing personal views not related to job.  They held multiple interviews with panels.
Interview Questions: Are you team player?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were wonderful, very friendly and not at all intimidating! I enjoyed talking to the staff members and toured the units that I applied to. The process was very organized.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a conflict in the past?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Casual and informal.   Informative;  The interview was short and to the point.   It was no nonsense.  They knew what they wanted.   I am not sure what else I can write or what else you are looking for.  I keep getting an error saying there is a 30 word minimum and I don't have anything else to add.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work for them?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth with great communication. It went so well it was a deciding factor of taking the job.  Everyone was very nice and welcoming to where I wasnt nervous at all.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weaknesses?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the hiring manager was mostly conversational. After the 1 on 1 interview with the manager, I also had brief informal interview with the other therapists. It was probably to let them have an input on my fit, not only for the job, but also my fit with the whole rehab team. The hiring process took a few months from the time of my initial interview, but I was eventually offered the job.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself; Do you have experience with this setting/population served; Are you familiar with G-codes; Are you comfortable making splints?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was already employed at Vidant Health, therefore i was chosen through the system.  My interview was with the business manager of the department, along with the administrator.  At the time, they needed someone quick and willing to work with large amounts of data, of which will be presented to physicians and as well administration within the hospital system.
Interview Questions: What type of data analytics skills and experience did i have?

title: Psychiatric Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at ECU Health (Ahoskie, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Meet with HR before the interview, fill out paperwork- they will also tell you your pay at this time. You then go to the unit you applied for and interview with the director, nurse managers and anyone else they see fit- they go around and ask you questions but also giving you the opportunity to ask questions. More conversational than anything
Interview Questions:
Basic questions 
1. What were challenges at your previous job 
2. Strengths 
3. Why psych nursing 
4. Words that describe you 
5. How do you handle conflict

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy to setup and schedule.  I have interviewed at a few Vidant entities and the process is very similar at each.  A staff member from Human resources contacted me and provided me with all the information necessary for my interview, including date and time, the interview process, and directions.  I came in for a one on one intervew with the manager and then a peer interview
Interview Questions: Describe a situation of diversity you experienced.  How did you work through any cultural or lingual limitations?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was more of a scheduling process for the in person interview. Very accommodating to me coming in from out of town. Allowed me to complete all interviews on same visit.
Interview Questions: Are you prepared to be extremely active during your working hours?

title: Discharge Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First the recruiter will give you a call to schedule an interview.  The interview will be scheduled for a few weeks later giving you plenty of time to prepare yourself.  On the day of the interview you meet with the recruiter at the recruitment office and they will go over benefits and salary range with you.  Then you will be directed to the actual hospital where you will meet with the Case Management team which is about 5-6 people.  After that portion of the interview you will meet with a peer group of about 5-6 members of case management. The entire process is about 3 hours.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for Vidant Medical?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Peer interview,  met with other staff on the unit and unit manager. Received a tour of the unit is would be working on. Had time alone with staff to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: PMO Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: First contact mid December. In person interview Jan 25, 2015.  Interview process unnecessarily long. Hiring manager, a VP of IT, arranged for two groups to interview me -- one group of worker bees and one group of managers.  Required me to prepare a 30 minute presentation on my "experiences in project management".  First presentation, to the worker bees, went well. Most of the managers -- the second interview -- were no-shows.  Only three managers showed up. Hiring manager read and replied to email throughout my presentation, which I felt was quite unprofessional and rude. My overall impression is of a disorganization. I am glad they didn't make me an offer, since I might have been tempted to take it and would have been miserable.
Interview Questions: Very standard interview questions.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview and hiring process was fairly simple as the hiring manager picked me via linked in and not their internal talent management system. the tedious part was having to interview with multiple levels of staff hiring manager, peers, and VP
Interview Questions: Why Vidant

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ECU Health
Interview Descriptions: Was called in for an interview and interview went well. It was mostly a behavioral interview that included mostly technical questions relating to my coursework at a local university. Was sat down with four other systems engineers who asked questions about situational examples.
Interview Questions: Why do you see yourself as a good fit for Vidant Medical?

title: Medical Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greensboro, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Well when I went in for an interview, I was advised I should know of an answer with in 5 to 7 business it dragged out for 3 months.  I wasn't advised of the job if i was turned down or not.  I kepted contacting the hr recruiter and talking with them saying I'm still in the running then all together stopped no response.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you above all the candidates that have applied?

title: Temporary Technical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took about a month and a half total. Once I was called for interview, I went in a week later, interviewed and was called within about a week.
Interview Questions: Basic

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a Phone interview followed by skype interview followed by site interview.  I met with multiple staff members, physicians, nurse managers, nursing staff, HR, etc.  Went on a tour of the facility and the area. Met with a realtor to tour different neighborhoods and schools. Overall the interview was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Basic

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with a nursing recruiter and then with the nursing manager on the same day. I received a call two to three weeks later to let me know that I was hired.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you? Why do you want to work in oncology? Describe yourself using three words.

title: Talent Acquisition Assistant - Temporary Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter contacted me to gauge my interest in the position I applied for. He scheduled a time that I could come in a meet with a peer interview team. I completed some background check forms that were emailed to me. I brought them to the interview and gave them to the receptionist. I met with a team that included other assistants, recruiters, and the HRIS specialist. They asked behavioral based questions and the itnerview lasted about 30 minutes. It was fairly informal and the group was welcoming. We met in the conference room. I was called back within 20 minutes and asked to interview for the full time position. I came back two days later and interviewed with two recruiters who needed a full-time assistant. It was again fairly informal and in one of the recruiter's office. They too asked behavioral based questions and we met for about 45 minutes. A day later (Friday, I believe) I received an email asking for my references. They used a tool called Skill Survey where I entered 5 references and their emails and submitted my list. The references then received an email from Skill Survey and filled out a survey based on my skills. Monday I was called and given an offer. All offers are contingent upon successfully clearing the reference check, the criminal background check, and an occupational health screening that includes vision, basic wellness, and a drug screening. Some positions have to do a lift test, but I did not.
Interview Questions: The questions were all standard. Nothing surprising or difficult.

title: Network Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8+ months. I interviewed at ECU Health (Greenville, NC) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for several positions with PCMH at the beginning of 2008, within a couple of month the status of my application final review. I called their HR department to confirm the meaning of this status, the person on the phone stated that this means that my résumé had been selected among the final list of candidates for the position this was at the end of 2008.
2009 went by.... nothing.
2010 went by.... nothing.
2011 at the beginning o the year I received  a call from someone at their IT department asking me if I was still interested in the position, luckily I have found better employment in another city.

If you have applied for a job for this hospital, please don't hold your breath for it.. continue applying for other jobs elsewhere their job statuses are not real or relevant.
Interview Questions: N/A
